description: "It was found that a part of the cancellation fee also goes to these online travel agencies if the ticket is booked through them,” an official said. “The airlines have been told that the cancellation fee, including the agent’s fee, should not exceed the base fare.”
title: Flight cancellation fees to don base fare cap

description: Adding to Tuesday's rally, the benchmark BSE Sensex advanced by 96 points in early trade on Wednesday as investors widened their portfolios amid sustained foreign fund inflows. The NSE Nifty was trading higher by 22.45 points or 0.27 per cent at 8,288.90.
title: Sensex extends rally, up 96 pts in early trade

description: he rupee appreciated by 3 paise to 66.74 against the dollar in early trade on Wednesday on increased selling of the US currency by exporters and banks amid higher foreign inflows. Forex dealers said a weakening dollar and a higher opening in domestic equities kept the rupee rising
title: Rupee opens 3 paise higher against dollar at 66.74

description: The World Bank has lowered its forecast for the global growth in 2016 to 2.4 per cent, saying that the world economy is facing stronger headwinds. The forecast is 0.5 percentage point lower than the bank's forecast in January.
title: World Bank cuts 2016 global growth forecast to 2.4%

description: US-India Business Council Chairman John Chambers told Prime Minister Narendra Modi that USIBC members plan to invest $45 billion in India in the next 2-3 years, in addition to the $28 billion already invested since Sept 2014.
title: US companies investing $45 bn in India: John Chambers

description: Leading bankers have welcomed the Reserve Bank's accommodative policy stance and expressed the hope that RBI's caution on inflation front is whittled by a good monsoon.
title: Bankers welcome RBI governor’s dovish policy tone

description: Fitch Ratings had in December affirmed India's 'BBB-' rating with a stable outlook and has forecast 8% growth for 2016-17. 'BBB-' is the lowest investment grade and just a notch above junk grading. Asked about its views on India, Fitch Ratings said they are now in the process of review.
title: India pitches for ratings upgrade with Fitch

description: Under the latest arrangement, private refiners will pay the central sales tax and state-run marketing firms will pay coastal freight costs for interstate cargoes shipped from plants in Gujarat. India's diesel use is rising along with an economy that grew by 7.6% in the previous financial year.
title: India ‘may halt diesel imports’, deal with pvt refiners

description: DRT presiding officer Benakanahalli's suggestion came as the consortium of banks and Diageo (Holdings) Netherlands pleaded before the Tribunal to take up their respective interlocutory applications for hearing on a priority basis. Benakanahalli said banks should sit and sort out the issue.
title: Mallya's Rs 2,000 in courts: Banks asked to coordinate
Rajan voices concerns over govt's bad bank proposal

description: The rupee resumed higher at 66.92 as against the last closing level of 66.97 per dollar at the Forex market and hovered in a range of 66.72 and 66.94 before finishing at 66.77, showing a gain of 20 paise or 0.30%. The rupee has gained by 68 paise or 1.01 per cent in four days.
title: Rupee hits new 3-week high, jumps 20 paise to 66.77

description: The finance ministry on Tuesday said the RBI monetary policy is broadly in line with government's expectations on growth and inflation. However, it said that business confidence will be restrained to an extent on account of unrelenting global factors.
title: RBI policy in line with our expectation: FinMin

description: Gold prices rose 0.19 per cent to Rs 29,442 per 10 gram in futures trade as participants created fresh positions, tracking a firm trend overseas. Globally, gold rose 0.10 per cent to US$ 1,244.70 an ounce in New York on Tuesday.
title: Gold futures rise 0.19% on global cues

description: Asian stock markets mostly rose for a third straight trading day Tuesday after Federal Reserve boss Janet Yellen said the US economy was still in good shape and that any increase in borrowing costs would be slow and low.
title: Most Asian markets climb after Yellen comments

description: Five states with no more than 32 per cent of India's population of senior citizens cornered 71 per cent of the Rs 34 crore that the Centre provided for maintenance of old-age homes over the past four years, according to an analysis of government data.
title: As India aged, 32% of elderly got 71% of government money

description: Committing to support NPA-ridden public sector banks, finance minister Arun Jaitley said they would be empowered and protected in case of "commercially prudent" settlement of bad debts. Jaitley said the bank CEOs and government had a candid discussion on the subject.
title: Govt for settlement bad loans, empowering PSBs: Jaitley

description: Larsen & Toubro Ltd has secured a contract to build a $135 million stadium for Qatar's 2022 World Cup, an official said. It's a boost for the company which is facing a slowdown in its key Mideast market due to low oil prices.
title: L&T wins $135 million Qatar World Cup stadium contract

description: HSBC is to restructure its global banking division to cut costs and make the business more "agile", according to a report. The reorganization is part of HSBC's plans announced last June to slash nearly one in five jobs and shrink its investment bank by a third as it seeks to boost profits.
title: HSBC to shake up global banking business to cut costs

description: Favouring consolidation in the public sector banking space, finance minister Arun Jaitley said the government as of now is looking only at SBI merging five subsidiaries as well as Bharatiya Mahila Bank with itself and a decision on this will be taken soon.
title: Govt to soon clear merger of SBI and associates: Jaitley

description: Extending gains against the American currency for the third day on Monday, the rupee firmed up by 28 paise to close at 3-week high of 66.97 on sustained selling of dollars by exporters on the back of strong foreign capital inflows.
title: Rupee ends at 3-week high of 66.97, up 28 paise
